Actinic Keratoses and Intraepithelial Ca.title: Actinic Keratoses and Intraepithelial Carcinoma (Bowen's Disease)
Actinic Keratoses and Intraepithelial Ca.description: These are rough, scaly patches on the skin that may become cancerous if untreated. Caused mainly by long-term sun exposure.
Actinic Keratoses and Intraepithelial Ca.symptoms: Red or brown scaly patches, sensitive to touch.

Basal Cell Carcinoma.title: Basal Cell Carcinoma (BCC)
Basal Cell Carcinoma.description: A common form of skin cancer caused by prolonged exposure to UV rays. It rarely spreads but requires treatment.
Basal Cell Carcinoma.symptoms: Flesh-colored or pinkish bumps that may bleed.
Basal Cell Carcinoma.treatment: Surgery, radiation therapy, or topical medications.

Benign Keratosis-like Lesions.title: Benign Keratosis-like Lesions (BKL)
Benign Keratosis-like Lesions.description: Non-cancerous skin growths often found in older adults, including seborrheic keratoses and age spots.
Benign Keratosis-like Lesions.symptoms: Thick, scaly patches ranging in color from light brown to black.
Benign Keratosis-like Lesions.treatment: Removal through surgery, cryotherapy, or laser if desired.

Dermatofibroma.title: Dermatofibroma (DF)
Dermatofibroma.description: Benign, firm nodules usually resulting from minor skin injuries. They are harmless and often require no treatment.
Dermatofibroma.symptoms: Small, hard lumps, often painful when pressed.
Dermatofibroma.treatment: Usually no treatment is needed, but they can be removed surgically.

Melanoma.title: Melanoma
Melanoma.description: The most dangerous form of skin cancer that originates from pigment-producing melanocytes. Early detection is crucial for successful treatment.
Melanoma.symptoms: Irregular moles with uneven borders, multiple colors, and rapid growth.
Melanoma.treatment: Surgical excision, immunotherapy, and chemotherapy for advanced stages.

Melanocytic Nevi.title: Melanocytic Nevi (NV)
Melanocytic Nevi.description: Commonly known as moles, these are usually benign growths formed from melanocytes. Regular monitoring is recommended.
Melanocytic Nevi.treatment: Generally none, unless changes occur. Surgical removal if needed.

Vascular Lesions.title: Vascular Lesions (VASC)
Vascular Lesions.description: Lesions formed from blood vessels, including conditions like hemangiomas and varicose veins.
Vascular Lesions.symptoms: Red or bluish discolorations on the skin due to underlying blood vessels.
Vascular Lesions.treatment: Laser treatment or surgery if required.
